description: Turkey's engagement in the Southern Caucasus is only the latest venture in a tougher foreign policy.
title: Viewpoint: Why Turkey is flexing its muscles abroad
title_page: Viewpoint: Why Turkey is flexing its muscles abroad - BBC News
maintext: The Assad regime's decision to give a free hand to Syria's Kurds in the north led to an autonomous Kurdish zone along Turkey's border and in 2014 the US decided to airdrop weapons to the Kurdish militants, considered to be a terrorist organisation by Turkey. This all fed the narrative that Turkey had to act alone and deploy military forces to protect its borders.
